short_summary: Organizational charting software and training for Department of Justice Canada.
description: The Department of Justice Canada has the mandate to support the dual roles of the Minister of Justice and the Attorney General of Canada. The Department supports the Minister of Justice in his responsibilities for 49 statutes and areas of federal law by ensuring a bilingual and bijural national legal framework. The Department also supports the Attorney General as the chief law officer of the Crown. The Department provides legal advice to the Government and federal government departments and agencies represent the Crown in civil litigation. The Human Resources and Information Services Branches maintain the departmental Human Resources Management System and peripheral Human Resources applications. Approximately 800 employees use these applications. Department of Justice Canada acquired Nakisa OrgManagement (Nakisa) as the Government of Canada standard system for organizational charting. This software system solution is able to define, present, navigate, and query information describing an organization's structure. The department has been using this software since 2008. It is no longer supported by the vendor and is no longer compatible with Treasury Board Standard hardware. This bid solicitation is being issued by SSC. The resulting contract will be used by SSC to provide shared services to the Department of Justice Canada. It is intended to result in the award of a contract for one initial year, plus three (3) one-year irrevocable options allowing Canada to extend the term of the contract.

# RFP for Organizational Charting Software and Training
**Title (English)/Titre (French):** SSC-22-00020745:T - Organizational Charting Software and Training for the Department of Justice Canada/Demander de Proposition de Logiciel d’organigramme et de Formation pour le Ministère de la Justice du Canada

**Procurement Details:**

* **Solicitation Number:** BPM017362/20745
* **Tender Closing Date:** December 12, 2022, 14:00:00
* **Contracting Entity:** Shared Services Canada
* **End-User Entities:** Department of Justice Canada
* **Security Requirement:** Non-sensitive

**Background and Requirements:**
The Department of Justice Canada seeks the procurement of organisational charting software and training to support their Human Resources and Information Services Branches. The software will be used by approximately 800 employees. The current software, Nakisa OrgManagement, is no longer supported by the vendor and is incompatible with Treasury Board Standard hardware.

**Contract and Term:**
The resulting contract will be used by Shared Services Canada to provide shared services to the Department of Justice Canada. The term will be for one year, with three one-year irrevocable options to extend the contract.

**Submission Information:**
* **Submission Method:** Electronic submission through the SSC Procure to Pay (P2) Portal
* **Language of Submission:** Either official language of Canada (English or French)
* **Bidder Inquiries:** Contact Marco Bonett at (343) 543-6307 or marco.bonett@ssc-spc.gc.ca

**Trade Agreements and Regulations:**
* **Trade Agreements:** All applicable trade agreements will be considered.
* **Comprehensive Land Claim Agreements:** N/A

Note: All trade agreements and regulations will be considered, and the Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The responsive bid with the highest combined rating of technical merit and price will be recommended for award of a contract.
